column3: The new exhibition {{c1::at}} the Museum of Art starts on Saturday.
A friend of mine is {{c1::in}} hospital. He was injured in an accident.
Shall we travel {{c1::in}} your car or mine?
I'm usually {{c1::at}} work until six o'clock, but sometimes I leave earlier.
I haven't seen Kate for some time. I last saw her {{c1::at}} David's wedding.
I don't know where my umbrella is. Perhaps I left it {{c1::on}} the bus.
Where did you stay when you were {{c1::in}} Moscow?
Sarah wasn't {{c1::at}} the party. I don't know why she didn't come.
We took a taxi, and Joe followed {{c1::on}} a motorbike.
Some people are {{c1::in}} prison for crimes they did not commit.
My sister is only 17. She's still {{c1::at}} school.
I enjoyed the flight, but the food {{c1::on}} the plane was awful.
Paul is a student {{c1::at}} Birmingham University.
I don't like cities. I'm glad I don't live {{c1::in}} a city.
